Question 25
 
 
Seasoning of timber for use in construction is done essentially to : 
 
(A) Smoothen timber surfaces  
(B) Increases strength and durability  
 
(C) Remove knots from timber logs  
(D) Cut timber in right season and geometry 
 
B

GATE 2021 
 [Afternoon Session]
Civil Engineering
PAGE
15
question_text:
Question 23
 
 
In general, the 
CORRECT
 sequence of surveying operations is  
 
(A) Field observation –Reconnaissance 
→
Data analysis 
→
 Map making
(B) Reconnaissance 
→
 Field observation 
→
 Data analysis 
→
 Map making
(C) Data analysis 
→
 Reconnaissance 
→
 Field observation  
→
 Map making
(D) Reconnaissance 
→
 Data analysis  
→
Field observation  
→
 Map making 
Ans. 
B 
Sol.
 
Correct sequence : 
 
Reconnaissance 
→
 Field observation 
→
Data analysis 
→
Map making
Hence, the correct option is (B).

Question 25
 
 
Seasoning of timber for use in construction is done essentially to : 
 
(A) Smoothen timber surfaces  
(B) Increases strength and durability  
 
(C) Remove knots from timber logs  
(D) Cut timber in right season and geometry 
 
B

GATE 2021 
 [Afternoon Session]
Civil Engineering
PAGE
15
explanation_text:
Sol.
 
Seasoning of timber increases strength and durability of timber which are used for different 
engineering purposes. 
 
Hence, the correct option is (B). 
Question 26 
 
The most appropriate tri-axial test to assess the long term stability of an excavated clay slope is  
 
(A) Consolidated drained test  
(B) Unconfined compression test  
 
(C) Unconsolidated undrained test 
(D) Consolidated undrained test 
Ans. 
A
